content: quote: Socialism is the involuntary expropriation of the means of production. Socialism is NOT loaning companies money until they can pay you back. If THAT"S the definition of Socialism, you better explain all the previous bailouts and bank seizures of the last 150 years. All these companies getting Federal money will NEVER be government owned. Indeed, even the bank seizures merely guarranteed profit and "socialised" the risk. As a long time honest to God Socialist, I can tell you point blank that I support almost none of these moves - Because they are the very opposite of Socialism. So replacing board members/CEO's with for lack of a better term "government lackeys" falls into the category of "just loaning money". How about dictating again what cars will be built? Is that "just loaning money?" Restricting compensation of management is just "loaning money?" What about taking away the board members voting rights on the board? Why have them there and not outright remove them? Because then there might be a lawsuit. These dudes that work at GMAC and GM are just as guilty as this administration It is our money bailing out the union employees, CEO's, and management. We will ensure the clowns who put themselves billions of dollars in the hole get their pension. How insane is this? The union gets a crapload of money for putting cars together as is, the sups and execs get a crapload of money marketing cars…meanwhile they are losing profit. The union wants more the execs want more they all get what they want and they lose money faster as a company. I am paying for that turd on the line putting lug nuts on a wheel at what ever $$ amount. I am paying for that exec to keep his mansion…meanwhile my taxes are not reduced in the slightest dwindling my chances of sending my kids to a decent non-public school. WTF is that all about????? Then in steps the government…we loan them money at first with no stipulation other than it will be paid back with interest…bad move on our part. Now we loan them MORE and MORE money and try to dictate with mandates what to build. WTF is THAT? You can slice that dirt pie any way you want grachus but when you boil all the fat away, government run/controlled/owned is socialism.

content: That's why we continue to get into these messes. A bunch of politicians, many of whom have never run a lemonade stand, let alone a multi-billion dollar corporation are trying to tell these corporations their opinion on the right way to do business. If these banks want to pay back the money let them. If they want to pay bonuses to their executives let them. If they fail, so be it. A couple more years of this administration and no one will have any need for money anyway. We will all have "free" health care, drive a white "smart car", and live in the same "cookie cutter" two bedroom apartment paid for by the government.
